page.title: 19LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {CHANGING TIMES. Primary schoolchildren's parents were asked, "What changes have taken place since you were a child?" {"Litter has increased and in the past {there were local street cleaners but {these no longer exist." {"We used to see colliers getting on {and off the Aberaman Colliery bus.When {they had finished work they would be {covered in coal dust and we would {dread catching that bus because our {clothes would get dirty." {"Nowadays you are lucky to see a {policeman in the street." {"We think children are more unruly and {destructive and there is less respect {for other people and their property." {"Traffic has increased. The only {traffic in our day was the Co-op bread {man and the pop man." {"Corner shops have also disappeared."
